title: We admitted we were powerless over our addictionâ€”that our lives had become unmanageable

questions.prompt: Describe a situation where you felt powerless over your addiction.
questions.help: Be specific and honest about your experiences. What happened? How did you feel?

questions.prompt: How has your life become unmanageable?
questions.help: Consider the impact on relationships, work, health, and daily responsibilities.

questions.prompt: What have you tried in the past to control your addiction?
questions.help: List all attempts you've made and why they didn't work.

questions.prompt: What consequences have you faced due to your addiction?
questions.help: Be thorough - physical, emotional, financial, legal, social consequences.

questions.prompt: How do you feel about admitting powerlessness?
questions.help: It's okay to have mixed feelings. Write honestly about your resistance or acceptance.

questions.prompt: What areas of your life are most affected by unmanageability?
questions.help: Think about work, relationships, finances, health, self-care, responsibilities.

questions.prompt: Describe a time when you lied to yourself about your addiction.
questions.help: What justifications or rationalizations did you use?

questions.prompt: How has denial kept you sick?
questions.help: Reflect on how refusing to see the truth prevented you from getting help.

questions.prompt: What does acceptance mean to you?
questions.help: How is acceptance different from giving up?

questions.prompt: What are you willing to do differently now?
questions.help: Based on this step, what changes are you ready to make?
